Tasting Notes: Mango New England Pale Ale
passion fruit pale
Pale Ale
With its light fragrance, lovely malt flavours and long hoppy after palate, Adnams Lighthouse shines through as another champion beer from Adnams.

mild ale style beer. Dark red/brown in colour it has an aroma of caramel and nutty chocolate. The toffee and chocolate also come through on the palate along with hints of red fruits, all balanced by a smooth bitterness
Black in colour and creamy in mouthfeel, this delicious Porter is packed full of delectable dark fruits for a sweeter finish in this rich, nutty, spicy beer.
SINGLE MALT ANF SINGLE HOP PALE
REAPERS SUMMIT, AMARILLO AND CHINOOK HOPS RECIPE GIVES IT A CINDER TOFFEE, MALTY TASTE WHICH WE LOVE AND WE’RE SURE YOU WILL TOO
Powerful, dark & full flavoured ale from Masham, Yorkshire.

The Rev. James Gold was added to the range in 2015 and brewed in the same style as its original counterpart.  It is a crisp, sweet golden ale with fresh fruit flavours that are balanced by an intriguing depth and light malty aroma.
Pale gold in colour, with a crisp malt edge and sharp bitterness. plateau has been hopped at different stages of the brew, with a big mic of us and nz hops

A traditionally brewed and cask conditioned beer, with New World hop additions. Cask beer is a live product and deserves to be handled with care and attention to be served at its best. A reliable and consistent crowd-pleaser

An etremely clean drinking pale golden ale with a strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from cascade hops. this beer is full bodies and full flavoured yet gentle enough to make it a favourite session beer

a best bitter brewerd in a traditional sussex style using extra pale ale concerto, crystal and chocolate malts with east kent golding hops. typical of dark star ales, the best bitter relies on the heavy-handed addition of aromatic hops late in the boi
a blend of columbus, chinook, cascake, crystal and warrior aroma hops by the sack full - then dry hopped during conditioning

Flavoured with black treacle, Dragon’s Breath is a unique winter warmer beer that was launched in the snows of December 2010. Deep ruby-brown coloured, rich and full-bodied with a delicious aftertaste of morello cherries, this classic beer is available from October to April.
Jail Ale is our original beer, which quickly achieved fame across Dartmoor and beyond. A full-bodied, deep golden brown beer,
Dartmoor Legend is a classic cask-conditioned beer. Smooth, full-flavoured and balanced, with a crispy malt fruit finish.
russet coloured best bitter
oatmeal laden breakfast stout
a silky smooth stout
Pale Ale is a crisp, lighter ale with a subtle bitterness and a fruity perfumed aroma. It's an excellent session beer.
Orchid is a dark mild, lightly spiced with vanilla.
"Award-winning, honey-coloured classic  Pale ale brewed with English hops, malt and oats. Sweet fruit aromas lead into a crisp, clean finish."

Beast is a full-bodied dark porter. It’s dark mahogany-brown in colour, with a hint of crimson. Rich aromas of toffee, treacle, Mocha coffee, vinous fruit, and chocolate. There’s more complexity on the palate with fruitcake, a hint of rum, more Mocha coffee, herbal hoppiness, vinous fruit, and a bittersweet finish that’s smooth yet complex, rich but not cloying

The straw-coloured beer is described by beer writer Adrian Tierney-Jones as ‘the kind of beer to perk up weary palates’. There’s a suggestion of aromatic gin-like botanicals and a gentle spiciness on the palate, which lead to a delicate floral hoppiness and the suggestion of citrus before it finishes dry and lightly fruity.

Twice named World Champion Beer, Fuller’s ESB is one of the most decorated ales of its time. A winner born and brewed, it’s a strong, full-bodied ale that has delighted drinkers for decades with its smooth, mellow bitterness and superbly satisfying finish

A silky-smooth premium ale, Horndean Special Bitter was originally the flagship beer of Gales Brewery in Hampshire. First launched in 1959, it’s still brewed with the same passion and pride today – and the age-old recipe continues to go down a storm.
Amber, malt driven bitter, smooth and full-flavoured
Rich, red ale, with a zesty, lingering hop character
Smooth, rich, creamy, complex smoked porter
Using a blend of four local hops, water filtered through the Sussex Downs over 30 years, and Harvey's unique 60 year old yeast strain, Harvey's Best Bitter is the embodiment of Sussex.
Malty and Mellow. Soft and slightly sweet with a dry, nutty aftertaste akin to an infusion of ground nuts.

Old Ale is a firm favourite during the autumn and winter months. A dark, warming brew. Burnt sugars and roasted malts compliment the premium Maris Otter barley, supplanting the light bitterness of aroma hops. With hints of dried fruit and dates, this rich ale has been likened to the oak: steadfast throughout the year, regardless of the season.

Prince of Denmark - A complex beer with aromas of leather, chocolate and liquorice, with a lingering taste. Brown, amber and black malts are mixed with pale ale malts to give this beer its strong aroma and colouring.
Bitter & Twisted is Harviestoun's golden ale. Complex, sweet and dry, this makes an excellent session beer.
A spicy, fruity amber ale. The perfect drop to share wi' the chieftain o' the puddin
A spicy, fruity amber ale.
A rich dark stout with a strong roasted malt flavour and a long, smooth aftertaste.
Taiphoon is a pale, thirst-quenching ale with a distinctly hoppy, yet flower palate. The addition of lemongrass gives a zing to the flavour
Our legendary winter warmer. Brewed with Fuggles and East Kent Goldings hops, Winter Lightning is very lightly spiced and deceptively drinkable

Longer nights require richer pints. New Old London is a modern London Porter for darker days. Slip into this malty hug of six different malts for safety. Roasty, toasty and hoppy in all the right places.
American-style pale ale. Fruity flavour with an assertive bitterness.
A fruity and hop-forward session beer fermented with a New England yeast strain. Aromas of stonefruit and pine, a reserved malt profile and a clean, dry finish.

Dark beers used to be the workers' drink of choice after a day's toil, thanks to their light taste. Times have changed, but our CAMRA gold-winning Dark hasn't. Cask-ale fanatics love it for its smooth, well-rounded character, sweet undertones and full malty aftertaste. And modern workers still reach for it after a day at the digital coalface.

First brewed in 1950, our malty award-winning Moonraker is dedicated to a local legend. The story goes that farmers close to the JW Lees brewery once fell into a pond, attempting to rake out a reflection of the moon they mistook for a truckle of fine Lancashire cheese. This strong ale should be handled with care, but its fruity aroma and rich, sweet flavour are now the stuff of legends too.

Manchester's rain is infamous, but it's made us who we are. Not only did it help create our textile industry, but it's inspired some of our greatest names, from Lowry to Morrissey to Michael (our Head Brewer). JW Lees Stout is a dark and brooding ale that takes its inspiration - and its main ingredient - from those same northern skies. Made with pride using the finest northern water.
This is a stout with a shake-up! Light-bronze in colour but with all the distinctive rich flavours of a brooding stout. Vanilla sweetness from the lactose provides a silky finish.
Choc Coconut Porter  Silky smooth coconut and rich, dark chocolate in luxurious, creamy malt.
American hops with ginger for a fruity and warming light beer.
A black version of an American Pale Ale. Light and hoppy with a subtle malt
A dark bitter stout. Roast and nut aromas with a fruity balance of hops and dark malt provide an excellent lingering finish.
A full bodied, black porter, with a balanced hop aroma & rich blend of chocolate & roast flavours, giving way to a subtle sweet fruit finish.
a dark mild brewery witb pale,m roasted barley and crystal malts and 100% amarillo hops. this traditional beer has a full round flabour with a slight but distinctive bitter finish
Our Winter special, this stout is flavoured with marzipan and dried fruit
Pale gold light ale, hopped with Chinook and Mosaic.
Golden ale using a Single Mash And Single Hop (SMASH), in this case, Golden Promise malt and Mosaic hops
Rich and dark beer with sweet cocoa and dark malty aromas. The blend of various dark malts gives lavish chocolate flavour and coffee like aromas.
Velvety mouthfeel and full bodied richness. A fruity hop bite balances this creamy milk stout.
Big dark malt flavours combine with a sweet and fruity hop taste to make this strong porter exceedingly drinkable.
Light gold in colour, bursting with citrus and tropical hop flavours and sensationally refreshing.
This spicy, rich and unique beer is bursting with chocolate and coffee malt flavours

Our kiwi-style IPA. A simple yet robust malt bill of Pale and Cara malts give the beer sweetness and incredible amounts of body. Nelson Sauvin and Motueka hops are the standout characters on stage with big top notes of papaya, mango and guava.

Our homage to London’s greatest export. This Porter is dark brown, almost black, in colour and is reminiscent of Porters of old. Big coffee notes leap from the glass with a slight charred oak aroma in the background. The palate is greeted by sweet dark berries followed by espresso and dark chocolate

A dark and more-ish Premium Bitter. One of our first ever beers and brewed with lots of Pale Malt for sweetness with the addition of Chocolate and Crystal Malt for body and colour. English hops, First Gold and Bramling Cross give a lovely spiciness and a beautiful bitterness.
A classic best bitter, deep amber in colour and displaying classic English hedgerow hop characteristics harnessed from a blend of Challenger, Fuggles and Whitbread Goldings Variety hops

Jet black, with a creamy head, Howl is Rooster’s our annual, ever-changing imperial stout. This version has been brewed with the addition of rich, dark chocolate and fresh ginger, resulting in a delicious, decadent and complex beer

A classic approach to a style of beer first developed in Victorian London. Roasted malt and chocolate flavours are abound in London Thunder; a smooth, dark porter brewed using a blend of seven malts and English hops

Copper-coloured, with a light malty aroma, a floral, even cedar taste, and a sharp tang of bitter grapefruit, this is an ale that has the strength of character to take on tasty dishes like stews, hard cheeses and meat-packed pasties.
Floral beneath a delicate, spicy tangerine scent with a touch of toffee. And its bittersweet finish is great for game, sausages or a chocolate fudge sundae

Bursting with fruit, within its bittersweet scent you’ll pick up lime and mangoes with a little lychee. And its creamy texture contains a slight strawberry finish. Enjoy with white meats, fish or a 99.
The creation of our Senior Brewer Darren James, Lansdown is big, bold and well-constructed, with multiple layers of hop flavour and notes of tropical fruit, lime zest and pine forest.

Crafted from British hops, Maris Otter barley and Cornish spring water, Cornish Best is an easy-drinking, traditional, well balanced bitter with wide appeal. At 3.5% ABV, this superb ale bursts with rich malt, biscuit and fine fruit character followed with a flint-dry finish.
This strong, dark, and aromatic cream stout is rich black velvet in colour, with coffee and vanilla notes coming from the blend of local malts and hops
A dark, sweet, full-bodied, plum porter. Background notes of damson and blackcurrant are followed by the fruitiness of the plum in flavour and aroma
A smooth porter with a variety of flavours including liquorice, caramelised toffee and treacle. Brewed with a blend of coloured malts, Raven is well balanced with bags of personality
ipa
hazy juicy ipa
peach and mango pale ale
jam donut pale ale

Drink Name: Salty Caramel Stay Puft Marshmellow Porter
Tasting Notes: marshmallow porter
Well-rounded porter with fruity, sweet notes over a backdrop of hoppy flavour. Deep red in colour but not in taste, the plum lightens the deepness on the palate.

Ignore the strength, this is one easy drinking beer.  A rich, sweet barley wine with a heady, alcoholic nose and complex flavour profile. Brewed since 1994 by appointment to the Queens Royal Lancers. They’re tough enough to sink a few... are you?
A classic ruby dark mild, smooth like velvet, sweet and creamy. You’d be fooled into thinking we were talking about a chocolate box selection.

A stout like no other. The antithesis of bitter Irish stouts, this is creamy, smooth with underlying chocolate undertones imparted by generous amounts of roasted malts and oats. Pours with a dark body and ivory head. It’s a tall, dark handsome pint.

A strong, dark mild brewed using pale crystal and two types of chocolate malt. Full-bodied and malty but with a dryish, chocolatey edge. Inspired by Strawberry Hill House, the “Little Gothick Castle”, not so far from the brewery.
Brewed with dark malts and second fermented with honey, this strong dark beer has chocolate, coffee, caramel and (of course) honey featuring in its aroma and flavour.
A spicy red ale with fruity undertones. A taste with hints of caramel and roasted malts, a floral aroma from the willamette hops and a clean lasting bitterness to finish
a hop forward pale ale made with amarillo, centennial and citra
A classic Stout with deep chocolate and mocha flavours; this rich, velvety and wonderfully drinkable beer
An easy drinking golden beer where tropical flavours come to the fore ahead of a subtle yet rewarding bitterness
Ruby Mild. A very dark red mild ale with a nutty taste and a gentle roasted malt aroma. This smooth and easy drinking beer is a session strength classic

brewed in January 2016 to commemorate the original Wimbledon Brewery fire of 1889. Now the Phoenix rises in the form of a delicious, London porter. Smooth and rich with hints of chocolate, spice and red fruit. These all combine to produce a great depth of flavour

SW19 Summer Ale, brewed with English, Australian and New Zealand hops for an all-round summer experience. The perfect summer beer, light straw in colour, subtle citrus notes, hints of malt and a satisfying crisp finish.
A pleasing aroma of malt and rich fruit with citrus notes is the introduction to this Woodforde's classic.
Dark beer. A Supreme Champion Beer of Britain! Our deep, ruby-red ale graces the senses with comforting splashes of warm hints.
Initial sweetness quickly followed by a peppery hop which fades into liquorice and chocolate raisins, then a very long warming finish.

Centurion's Ghost is a multi gold medal award winning dark ruby ale. It has a smooth roasted malt palate and a combination of Challenger Fuggle and Bramling Cross hops give it a subtle bitterness with autumn fruit flavours that linger on the aftertaste.
